job_description: Employer:  Petroleum Institute of Thailand (PTIT)Area of education or work experience: Petroleum, Electrical, Industrial or Environmental EngineeringJob scope:To perform research and analytical works on assigned study project(s) in the field of oil & gas, petrochemicals, and/or energy development sectorTo coordinate with external parties and manage PTIT Task Forces and Standing Committees activitiesTo gather and disseminate information, and independently analyze data in support of a technical service/policy-related project undertaken by PTITTo represent PTIT in any assigned meetingsTo perform any other jobs as assigned by Executive DirectorRequired skills:Research, analytical and report-writing skillsEnglish proficiencyPresentation, coordination and communication skillsIT proficiency (PowerPoint, Excel, Word, others)Positive attitude, hard-working, result-orientedMulti-tasking and self-improvement abilityPTIT offers a competitive employee remuneration & benefit package.For more information, please contactMs. Sutatip Onyoo at 02 537 0440-8 ext 502 or 098 495-1956

JOB TITLE : Refinery EconomistPURPOSE :-To plan, develop, initially analyse and advise refinery production plan in order to maximise company profitability-To develop, and advise an economically optimised alternative for refinery operation, trading, project investment and business synergy in order to improve company profitabilityPRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES : To produce production planning by gathering/ consolidating planning information and verifying/ thoroughly analysing production plan in order to ensure that reliable, accurate, optimal plan is developed To develop, initially analyse, verify, recommend and publicise an optimum refinery production plan in order to economically guide refinery scheduling, operation and financial planning Advise and provide key economic drivers to steer plant on daily basis in accordance with market movement. Communicate the drivers to plant through schedulers and business units Identify margin improvement opportunities, participate in the technical development process from screening through closure of those evaluation by working closely with process engineering, operations, supply chain, commercial, business & strategic development team for internal and external business synergy project To be the custodian of development and maintenance of margin improvement tool/ project such as Marginal Economic Monitoring (MEM) in order to improve quality of advice/ decision and company profitability Perform economic evaluation of crude oil and feedstock in order to ensure that the right crude oil and feedstock is purchased Coordinates and updates the crude assays using multiple information sources including crude assays, cargo quality data from actual cargo sample / available reliable data source. Being custodian of feedstock acceptance matrix (Crude Acceptance Matrix) to gather feedstock technical evaluation to support feedstock purchasing decision To verify and recommend economic justification of internal and external business synergy projects and commercial deal in order to strengthen company competitive advantages and benefit To support development of commercial deal, business synergy project and financial planning in order ensure that all deals are smoothly and economically developedTIME SPENT :70% Refinery economic study and production plan support15% Reporting (KPI, HMR, MEM, Throughput Planning Committee, etc)10% Work planning, developing, studying5% Others (visitors, meeting, etc.)ADDITIONAL COMMENTS ABOUT THE JOB INCLUDING BRIEF DESCRIPTION OF MAIN CHALLENGE OF THE JOB :Refinery operation and trading are complicated. In order to maintain sustainable competitive advantage, it is essential to ensure that the business is driven in economic direction. An economical response in both commercial and operation point of view can greatly contribute to improvement in company benefit. Incumbent must have a good technological knowledge with refinery operation and optimisation. Incumbent should be familiar with the basis of the international and domestic crude oil/product markets. Incumbent must demonstrate capability to translate technical know-how to realised business benefit. Incumbent should get well with other colleagues to ensure efficient and effective communication and cooperation. Incumbent should demonstrate ability to work under pressure and time constraint.MINIMUM KNOWLEDGE & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED TO PERFORM THE JOB SATISFACTORILY :Incumbent should be a graduate, ideally in Chemical Engineering discipline. Knowledge in business management and production planning is an advantage.He/ She should have good experience of at least five years in Technology and Refinery Operation.Please send resume to CChadavipoo @ fircroft . com (อีเมลติดกันหมด)Fircroft Thailand22nd Floor, 2202 Pacific Place II Building, 142Sukhumvit Road, Bangkok,, Thailand 10110Contact Chairat Chadavipoo02 653 2947 Ext 136                                    RMS 222409

job_title: Head of Project Engineering and Maintenance
job_description: As a result of expanding, this world's leading FMCG manufacturer based in Rayong is recruiting an outstanding Project Engineering and Maintenance Manager (x 1 vacancy) to responsible for all changes and improvements at the plant, related to new products development, production efficiency improvements and capacity increase starting from scope definition till final hand over to production team as well as maintenance management systemAbout the Head of Project Engineering and Maintenance role:Reporting to the Plant Director (Foreigner) and working closely with Regional Director (Foreigner) based in Singapore, you will play a vital role to maintain the understanding and knowledge of company's standards and best practices in project executions as well as plant's technology and maintenance. The salary range for this role is THB 200k - 250k per month with allowance + bonus + provident fund.Key Responsibilities:Ensure coordinated actions across plant functions as well contractors, suppliers and other partnersEnsure timely plant CAPEX/OPEX budget planning for department as well as project-related budgets and control the execution and manage investment portfolio of the factoryEnsure timely and transparent reporting of Capex projects execution according company standards and manage & control KPI related to engineering function/departmentTake a leading role in defining and execution of plant technical development strategy, ways of reconstruction, reasonable level of process automation, environment protection measures, lean production, industrial safety and energy effectiveness of production as a mid-term and long-term strategyHandle preparation and start-up of new production lines and/or products including cross-functional collaboration, problems solving, information exchange. Lead and execute all changes related the product, it's packaging, as well as technological processTo succeed in this role, you must have the ability to lead and unite effectively and possess a keen understanding of project engineering and maintenance management within FMCG industry.Key Requirements:Bachelor's degree or higher in engineering or other related fields with a minimum of five years' experience in FMCG manufacturing environmentKnowledge of main business processes, technology as well as essential stages of manufacturing and packaging of finished productExceptional project management skills with a track record of delivering high quality projects in a manufacturing environmentAbility to listen & integrate business needs with detailed technical inputsGood command of Thai and English is a mustThis leading FMCG manufacturer needs no introduction and is recognised as the leader in their field of expertise. The culture is demanding but if you are confident and have a can-do attitude the potential rewards are significant and there are great opportunities to progress in this dynamic company.If you are a progressive Project Engineering and Maintenance Manager with solid experience in FMCG manufacturing, this is an excellent opportunity to work with an industrial leader that is consistently breaking new ground.Apply today for this exciting opportunity.Robert Walters Recruitment (Thailand) LimitedRecruitment License No.: น. 1188 / 2551

Title Utility and Project managerUtility Management - Maintenance Project Management - Continuous Improvement - Sustainability - Energy Saving - Up to 160 Plus other benefit - Based on Pak ChongThe Client A well-known food producer The RoleManpower management to support Utilities & Facility operation 24/7 as per production plan and PM required.Support engineering team and provide solution, analysis and troubleshooting for machines equipment to keep machines are running 24/7.Operation management in Utilities supplies to production lines without shortagePreventive & Corrective maintenance in Utilities and Facility machines and serve to production with good efficient.Develops reviews and updates of machines operation preventive & corrective maintenance program to ensure the readiness of all the plant equipment in order to meet the production volume requirement.Plan and perform annually preventive maintenance for Electrical system 115KV - 22KV.Perform test and inspection the fire prevention system (Fire pump, Fire alarm system, sprinkler system, grounding system etc.) as regular basis to ensure the system is readiness for emergency case.Maintain and improve plant's infrastructure with efficient to compliance with law, regulatory and PI standard.Provide mandatory training plan for technician according to safety, law, FM global and others requirement.Monitoring and report monthly utility consumption and provide improvement needs.Set the preventive maintenance plan for weekly, monthly, quarterly and yearly basis and coordinate with machine maker or supplier for overhauling schedule.Provides appropriate counsel to subordinates. Coaches team for proper guidance in connection with their functions and responsibilities.Developing the Process parameter and continue improvement for productivities, Safety, food safety, and SustainabilityPerforms other tasks / duties in support of the goals and objective of the business.Follow QFS Procedure and monitoring process to ensure that Product without Quality Food safety IssueFollow Safety Procedure and monitoring process to ensure that machine and equipment without safety IssueFollowing job / task assignment from Engineering ManagerThe PersonMale / Female, age 35 - 48, with a degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering . Master's Degree or overseas education would be a plus 10+yrs experience in leading & managing Utility Maintenance Operation from Consumer / Food / FMCG industries with knowledge of Utility equipment & systems maintenance and related engineering improvement for Waste Water, Boiler, HVAC, Electrical Supply, and all other facilities within manufacturing companiesMust have experience with multi -national manufacturing companiesTeam leadership Good communication skills in EnglishIf you are interested, please apply via Jobs DBArgyll Scott Asia is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

As a Validation Engineering Supervisor, you will respond the management and execution of all validation activities related to production process.Client DetailsOur client is a leading medical devices company. job_title: Test & Commissioning Engineer Power supply (1 year contract) /วิศวกรทดสอบระบบการทำงาน แหล่งจ่ายไฟของรถไฟ BTS
job_responsibilities: ['Position:Test & Commissioning EngineerPower supply (1 yearcontract)วิศวกรทดสอบระบบการทำงานแหล่งจ่ายไฟของรถไฟ BTSLocation:Bangkok (Office at Bangna)Working day:6 Day Per Week, OT 32 hour/MonthWorking Hours: Depend on jobSalary:45 -55 KAdditional allowance: Travelling 5,000 /MonthResponsibilities:-Manage smooth commissioning of the project by Coordinating between the company and the Contractor.Supervise and approve commissioning plans in accordance with project guidelines.Review designs and define onsite commissioning activities.Prepare and maintain commission records of site observations, testing processes and checklists.Outline procedures, norms and details for writing the Systems Manual.Monitor installation, submittals and usage of engineering tools adhering to project and commissioning guidelines.Guide testing processes and motivate specialists to achieve standard results.Assist with identification and redressal of commissioning and malfunction issues.Track and review progress through meetings.Evaluate contractual commissioning statistics and instruction guidelines in accordance with the needs of the project.Compile commission report data for summarizing.Assist in summarizing and updating commission records.Schedule and supervise operational reviews in association with functional staff.Create an empowering and inspiring work culture with the commissioning team.Attain customer satisfaction through adhering to owner guidelines with the entire project team.']

job_responsibilities: ['Position:   Construction Department Manager (Oil and Gas Business)Location:   BangkokTerm:      PermanentResponsibilitiesRoutine administration of the Construction and Subcontract Department.Continuously improve the working method in the Construction and Subcontract Department.Act as a focal point with regards the matters related to Construction and Subcontract Department.Follow-up on staff’s performance, competency and career development.Ensure adequate staffing level and capability to ensure smooth execution of the project.Identify training needs, develop training plans, arrange and provide training for staffs to upgrade their competency/capability.Foster and maintain relationships with PMT, Clients and Subcontractors.Support necessary activities for EPC, EPCM and PMC proposal.Liaison with counter partner TPGMCarry out site visit for capturing the point of awareness and consult/give the advice either in technical or administration.Required ']

job_responsibilities: ["Engineering ManagerPosition: Engineering ManagerDirect Report to: Managing DirectorEmployment Status: PermanentAccountabilityThe jobholder is accountable for engineering execution, maintaining budget set and agreed, and meeting targets and goals set by projectsIn addition, jobholder is to support business development team in growing local engineering market.Responsibilities• Establish Engineering strategy and annual basis actual plan to comply with company strategy• Carry out approved department execution plans in accordance with relevant specifications, statutory and other contractual requirements with due regard to safety, operability, constructability and installation aspects.• Establish and develop planning, methods, procedures and work instruction in order to meet project's requirements• Develop personnel competence level to carry out studies, tenders and projects.• Establish business development and marketing strategy including annual basis actual plan to comply with company strategy.• Find and evaluate possible projects, both internal in company and external, which are within the given strategy.• Continuously check/report opportunities of interest in the region, SE Asia, for other company units• Establish contact with potential new clients and maintain contact with key present clients• Develop and maintain prospect lists.• Cooperate with applicable projects on debriefing with clients during and/or after projects• Cooperate with construction, engineering and procurement on improving competitive position."]

An exciting Lead Engineer (x1 vacancy) job has just become available at heavy machinery business based in Rayong, Thailand. This is a role for Lead Engineer who thrive on challenging opportunity. About the Lead Engineer Role:You will be leading the team and play a vital role to deliver sound and effective engineering. The salary range for this role is THB 100k - 120k per month + benefits + massive bonus.Key Responsibilities:Leading projects, work planning, directing and overseeing designers and engineers assigned to your projects, design reviews (both internal and with client), and checking deliverableDevelop study reports, proposals, scopes of work, schedules, material lists, design concepts, scope change documents, and corporate guidelineManage scope, schedule, and budgetManage the engineering and design process from inception to completionVisit customer sites for field workAssist in commissioning and start upReport to Expat General ManagerDevelop and implement specific plant policies/ procedures as required To succeed in the Lead Engineer job, you will need to have experiences on heavy machine industry with the ability to work effectively and co-operatively with the team.Key Requirements:Bachelor's degree or higher in Mechanical or Civil Engineering or related field in heavy machine, construction manufacturing10 years of heavy industrial experience in a design or project engineering role. Solid background in heavy machine businessProject management experienceStrong knowledge of mechanical engineering principles with an emphasis on mechanics, heavy lifting and transport businessMust have strong people management, leader skill and presentation skillGood command in English language This heavy machine company needs no introduction and is recognised as the leader in their field of expertise. The culture is demanding but if you are confident and have a can-do attitude the potential rewards are significant and there are great opportunities to progress in this dynamic company.If you are a driven and determined Lead Engineer with proven track record of achievements in manufacturing environment, this is an excellent opportunity for you.Apply today for this exciting opportunity.Robert Walters Recruitment (Thailand) LimitedRecruitment License No.: น. 1188 / 2551

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:Pre and Post Sales Support.Liaise with existing and new clients for technical and product sales support.Organize product training to sales and clients.Coordinate technical marketing activities with sales and marketing.Provide design and product advise to customers.Provide customer presentations and site visits.Managing and follow-up of customer technical issues.Site commissioning support for PV Power Plant’s main equipment. Liaise with suppliers and clients to manage quality and warranty claims.Provide drawings and simulation to support the sales activities in South-East Asia.Writes reports and technical literature to support sales effort.Able to work cross functional with Project entities.YOUR SKILLS:Bachelor of Engineering or Science in Electrical Engineering or Renewable Energy.Minimum of3-4 years of professional experience in the PV Solar industry.Experienced in PV Power Plant design.Proficiency in operating AutoCAD and HelioScope.Hands-on experience with PV Power Plant simulations tools (PVsyst, etc.).Experiences in sales and customer relationship is of advantage.Experience in PV inverter and PV Solar design is highly preferred.Good in written and spoken English.Have driving License and able to travel upcountry and overseas.Have services mind.

job_title: QS (Electrical/ Instrument/ Telecom) in Refinery (Many Positions)
job_description: Quantity Surveyor Electrical/ Instrument/ TelecomResponsibilities:Reviewing construction plans and preparing quantity requirements.Scrutinizing maintenance and material costs, as well as contracts to ensure the best deals.Liaising with site managers, clients, contractors, and subcontractors.Preparing reports, analyses, contracts, budgets, risk assessment, and other documents.Advising managers and clients on improvements and new strategies.Keeping track of materials and ordering more when required.Documenting any changes in design and updating budgets.Establishing and maintaining professional relationships with external and internal stakeholders.Traveling from the office to various sites as required.Quantity Surveyor Requirements:Bachelor's degree in Quantity Surveying, Engineering, Management, or similar.Construction estimating or finance experienced is advantageous.Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.Sound knowledge of construction.Excellent negotiating and interpersonal skills.Ability to organize, plan, and strategize.A valid driver's license.Great networking abilities.Fircroft ThailandPlease send resume to CChadavipoo @ fircroft . com (อีเมลติดกัน)22nd Floor, 2202 Pacific Place II Building, 142Sukhumvit Road, Bangkok,, Thailand 10110Contact K Chairat Chadavipoo02 653 2947 Ext 136

job_responsibilities: ['Job Description:Plans, organizes and controls the operation of the various functions of theSolar Rooftop, Solar Power Plantoperations. Directs the proper operation, repair and maintenance of the Solar Power Plant and other plant utilities and energy conservation and environment.Directs the engineering administrative function, including the maintenance of engineering records and development of forecasts for the Solar Power Plant budget and assists in its preparation.Manage, prioritize and resolve on timely basis all PV Fleet activities and issues that may impact the overall solar power plant performance.Calculation of solar project losses and energy uncertainty.Plan the overall of personnel, equipment, and materials to meet the requirements of the Solar energy plant.Directs the solution of problems in connection with maintenance of solar energy plant.Preparation of the capital budget plan for short term and long term planning of the solar power plant.Manages the capital and operating budget of the solar energy plant.Plans procurement and controls usage of the operation supplies of the solar energy plant.Ensures that all contractual obligations for power plants including laws, ordinances and contractsare met.Provide operation reports to management.Perform other duties and special projects as assigned.']
job_qualifications: ["s :Thai Nationality OnlyMale,age above 35 years old(Able to travel upcountry)Bachelor of Master's Degree inEngineering(Electrical or Civil Engineering)orany related fieldsAt least 2years experience inSolar project management including projects of at least 100kw+At least 5years experience inProject management and/or Construction operations Experience and understanding of Distributed Generation Solar ProjectsABCEP PV Installation professional certification preferredSolid understanding of Project management processAbility to travel regionally, depending on project locationStrong sense of leadership, interpersonal skills and drive for resultsProven ability to coach & manage teams, and the courage to manage people constructivelyGood analytical and problem solving skillsGood command of English (writing and speaking)Holding a Professional Engineer Licensesor above will be considered in advanceAble to drive a car with driver's licenseIf you are a passionate person described above who wants to broaden your experience with reputable renewable energypublic company, this is the role fit to you.Please send your application with full resume stating qualifications, experience together with a recent photo and your current and expected salary.Travel :This job based in Bangkokand require extensive travel within Thailand.Human Resources & Administration DivisionGunkul Engineering Public Company Limited1177, 8th Floor, Pearl Bangkok Building, Phaholyothin Road,Phayathai, Bangkok 10400Tel: 02 2425883-4Visit us atwww.gunkul.com "]

skillsGood command of English (writing and speaking)Holding a Professional Engineer Licensesor above will be considered in advanceAble to drive a car with driver's licenseIf you are a passionate More About UsBring your very own sense of pride and purpose as you help us drive forward the Fourth Industrial Revolution – creating a sustainable future for our planet, and your career. Join ABB and harness the power of our diverse global network, as you collaborate with and learn from our world-class teams. Above all, challenge yourself every day. Let’s write the future, together. “It is an exciting time to join ABB Power Grids. ABB and Hitachi have signed an agreement to create a joint venture (JV). By combining ABB Power Grids’ with Hitachi’s complementary strengths, we plan to form a new and stronger global leader in the power sector. ABB Power Grids and Hitachi will have more than 230 years of combined heritage and experience. Together, we will be well-positioned to shape the future of energy, with pioneering technologies, as the partner of choice for enabling a stronger, smarter and greener grid. The transaction is expected to be completed by the first half of 2020, subject to regulatory approvals. Join us on this exciting journey.” Recruitment Agencies please be aware that this role is being managed by the internal ABB Talent team directly. We will reach out to our preferred agency partners should we require support. Your adherence to our process is appreciated.Your ResponsibilitiesLeading the project team with clear guidelines, tasks and milestones, while motivating and providing feedback.Managing all aspects of the project to agreed-upon customer requirements and ensuring all technical, safety, quality and financial targets are met. Overseeing the development of project plan documents in relation to scope, budget, schedule, and risk management.Monitoring each stage of project implementation to ensure best practices in cost control, resource efficiency, risk management and health, safety and the environment. Identifying, analyzing and addressing project risks, with the regular sharing of lessons learned.Coordinating contract negotiation and claims with customers, in collaboration with the Supply Chain and Legal functions.Achieving project deliverables and compliance with contract requirements.Building strong relationships with customers and stakeholders.Living ABB’s core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business. Your backgroundA Bachelor’s degree or above in Electrical or Power system.More than 5 years of experience in power equipment manufacturing domain, working as a Project Manager with power transformers or related product. Demonstrated experience in management of project scope, cost, schedules and vendors/subcontractors.Sound knowledge of power transformer and the power transmission market.Knowledge of Microsoft ware and common office tools.A collaborative, solutions-oriented approach and strong communication skills.

job_title: Process  Engineering Manager (1) , Senior Process Engineer (2) / Automotive-Chonburi/TOEIC - 550 +
job_description: Our customer is Japanese automotive manufacturing in Amata-City, Chonburi , we are selecting smart candidate to support the dynamics firm with the following details...Type of process  : High pressure die-casting / Machining / Assembly / Chemical treatment...Size of employees: Total staffs 800 persons.Working location : All of manufacturing plant in Amata-City,Chonburi ( 3 locations )Required position1. ( need to coordinate with functional team )2. job_responsibilities: [" The Role:Job Description:  The Insulation inspector will mainly perform the work in the contractor's yard in Laem Chabang, Thailand, working in the Equinor construction team. Periodical travel to sub-contractors can be required.  Preparation for installation phase: * Assisting and helping contractor, vendors and sub-contractors for best possible preparation for the insulation installation phase. Verification of these activities. * Ensuring that means are made for easy and effective installation of insulation during construction  Insulation installation phase: * Inspection of process piping systems and related in-line equipment, valves, vessels etc. for the whole MSF module. Architectural and HVAC insulation inspections for the utility area of the module. * Cooperate with other disciplines in the project to ensure that handover of work fronts happens effectively between coating, E&I (heat tracing) and insulation.  Other tasks and responsibilities: * The work shall be executed in close cooperation with the Company's insulation supervisor on site. * Special focus on the HSE aspect of the designed solutions, both during installation and the operational life of the platform. * Give input to risks related to HSE, design and productivity and mitigating actions.Essential Skills / "]

job_title: Site Interface Manager (Oil and Gas refinery/Petrochemical) / Opening for the package
job_responsibilities: ["Fircroftis now enhancing their coverage to focus more on permanent Recruitment and Personnel Solution service. Now we're looking forSite Interface Manageras detail below;Working Day: Monday - SaturdayJob DescriptionThe Site Interface Manager operationally reports to the Site Director and functionally reports to the JV Directorate Interface Manager.The Site Interface Manager has overall responsibility for implementation of the external interfaces management on the job site, by implementing at Site the project specific Interface Management Plan and work processes and the COREWORX database, capturing the external interface agreements, monitoring related progress and schedule requirements are maintained and identifying/ initiating any contract change notices that may arise out of the interface requirements. Furthermore the management of the Thai Regulatory Authority Permitting aspects for the Project in accordance with the Permit Master Plan also falls within the remit of Interface Management. Act as focal point for communication and coordination, and for the timely solving of external interface issues on the job site in compliance with Quality and HSSE requirements Site management of interface management systems and tools (e.g. Coreworx etc) required to effectively control external interfaces at SiteInterface management focal point support for the existing facilities for dealing with issues for the brownfield works with particular focus to tie-ins and shutdown period activities Maintain the Project Interface Register via the COREWORX database for site related external interface queries which shall define who, what, where and when the external interface issues are to be resolved Management oversight & involvement for Thai Regulatory Authority permitting for the Project with particular focus to site related aspectsReport the status of Site based interface issues and their close-out in the weekly Interface Management Dashboard Report and the Interface Management Monthly Progress Report Report the status of Site based interface issues and their close-out at the weekly Interface Management MeetingsMonitor changes, potential variations and risks to schedule and costs from Interface Issues / Items.Raise and notify these to the Project Directorship to initiate follow-up action accordinglyProvide guidance and support to the Site Director for optimum resolutions to internal interfaces issues (between JV partners) at the Site"]

And minimum 5 years in manager level . job_title: Project Director (Infrastructure) railway/ highway/ port operator EPC Project
job_description: Responsibilities:Driving the company's objectives and goals and providing practical solutions to the senior management.Taking ownership of the business, spearhead its go-to-market strategy and project development activities, and being responsible for managing risk and delivering profit, including responsibility and maintaining in accordance with the law and regulations. Planning and implementing long term business strategies to achieve the company’s objectives.Managing and working with engineering and project development team for projects on hand.Monitoring on planning & scheduling, cost estimation, project administration, interface management and delivery.Project, EPC and contract management.Coordinating with internal teams and all relevant external parties e.g. sponsor/shareholder, industrial estate, contracts, lenders, lenders’ advisor and contractor.Leading and managing execution of the project by coordinating internal.Contract negotiation, contract reviewing and budget control.Presenting and reporting projects to management.Requirements:Bachelor’s degree in Engineering and master’s degree in Business Management, Finance, Economics or related fields.Minimum 12 years’ experience in project development or project management, of which 8 years in management level.Experience in infrastructure business such as railway/ highway/ port operator etc.Overseas Experience would be an advantage.Experience in management of scope, cost, schedules and vendors/subcontractors in varied contract arrangements.Sound knowledge of engineering techniques, processes and tools, and strong contractual knowledge.Inter-personal relationship skills, ability to communicate with people of different cultures and backgrounds.Strong business development, project development and corporate planning knowledge with commercial mind.Strong leadership and management skills.Fluent in English both of written and verbal and good computer literacy.Ability to travel/work in upcountry and abroad.Goal – Oriented, Unity, Learning, Flexible.please send resume to :CChadavipoo @ fircroft.com (อีเมล์ติดกันหมด)22nd Floor, 2202 Pacific Place II Building, 142Sukhumvit Road, Bangkok,, Thailand 1011002 653 2947 Ext 136(RMS0222279)

Siemens Power Generation Services (PS) has exciting opportunities forRemote Diagnostic Centre (RDC)Engineers.The successful candidates will work within a diverse team based in our Siemens Singapore office.This role is primarily office based and will be subject to continuous professional development from both academic and product related perspectives. Product development and more specificRemote Diagnostic Systemtraining requirements will be assessed during on-boarding and an appropriate personal development plan created and delivered thereafter.What are my responsibilities?Provide remote monitoring and reporting for assigned connected sites under Daily Monitoring, reporting to local RDC Manager.Remote Diagnostic Monitoring activity must be carried out to ensure that our customer’s equipment degradation and downtime is minimised.Create customer reports & ticketing to ensuring it is timely, concise and technically accurate whilst delivering maximum commercial leverage.Identify opportunities for development and support the overall RDS Research & Development engineering priorities.Work with the RDS Operations, Technical Services & Product Management teams to develop and sustain a continuous growth of the RDS value addition capability.Coordinate and execute root cause analysis to remove bottlenecks in data post processing (bug fixing).What do I need to qualify for this job?A genuine passion for data driven services, using data to drive better service.Qualified to degree level or equivalent in a relevant discipline and ideally will have worked in a remote diagnostics discipline.Experience in multiple Engineering environments including: Design Engineering, Controls Engineering, Assembly and Test, Installation & Commissioning, Performance Engineering, Support Engineering, Technical Helpdesk, Remote Diagnostic Services. Must be customer focused and be able to demonstrate leadership, trouble shooting, problem solving and analytical skills / decision making in a high pressure environment.Be analytical. Open & Inclusive. Pragmatic. Big-picture thinker.Initiative and be a flexible self-starter, working with minimal direction.Siemens offers a comprehensive reward package which includes a competitive basic salary, bonus scheme, holiday, allowances and pension.

job_responsibilities: [" Facility Management - Operation Manager Job Summary:  The Operation manager is responsible for the operational maintenance delivery at the country level for all sites. Lead the execution of the maintenance operations and is accountable for the quality of work, reporting and annual maintenance budget. 60% of the time is dedicated to validating HSSE delivery; ensuring suppliers are performing as expected and pro-actively managing the service delivery.  Key Responsibilities: Carrying out supplier accreditation in combination and HSSE team for all new suppliers and maintain a re-accreditation system aligned to the contract requirements. Engaged in contract management activities to actively manage suppliers and where applicable support the purchasing function and be able to complete spot buys. Manage the HSSE management system, ensuring training is given when required and suppliers are suitably qualified. Advise, promote and monitor the safe carrying out of work in the workplace, promote all HSSE related activities Conduct Asset Condition Surveys of the sites within their area of responsibility Prepare for bi-weekly and monthly meetings to discuss operational performance, be confident to discuss issues, understand trends within data and be able to propose resolution actions if required. When required be prepared to attend these meetings Within their area of responsibility ensure the annual planning cycle is adhered to, this includes understanding the phasing of spend over the year, the allocation of costs to agreed cost structures and the supplier spend profile. On a monthly basis be able to articulate variance in actual spend vs planned spend and be competent in adjusting forecasts to take into account the latest available information. Be able to discuss finance performance with country manager and client. Verify invoices for work undertaken at sites to validate the costs incurred are as invoiced. Assess the extent of equipment repair or replacement requirements necessary on sites and make recommendations for the most efficient and economic means of carrying out the required work. Carry out quality checks of recently completed maintenance and repair work and repair work to ensure work is carried out properly. Carry out quality checks on work in progress and check all major repair and replacement work to ensure that work is carried out properly. Ensure that asset data is updated on a regular basis Respond to emergency call outs and 'make-safe' work situations. Track statutory compliance requirements for the sites, to verify that work mandated by government regulations is completed. Coordinating with the Project Management Contractor (PMC) to ensure projects are delivered with minimum disruption to sites and that all relevant equipment data is received from PMC are updated in the system In conjunction with the country Supply Chain Manager develop and monitor the procurement strategy, to include suppliers which are going to be re-tendered, re-negotiated, those that need closer management and contingency plans for key suppliers. Pro-actively manage the supplier base, ensure regular operational meetings are held to review work performance against contracted requirements. Proactively manage the call center performance Manage and report to stakeholders & clients Manage team: Lead and support the local team to safely deliver projects and programs on time and within budget with the right on-time assurance, communication, and assurance. Report project risk, status, progress to stakeholder and line managers Manage and fulfil contract obligation together with the Operation manager. Deliver outcomes according to contract and yearly KPI Implement and comply to company and client management & assurance process Follow-up project P&L (invoices, payment, budget with operation teams, Regional Controller and outsourced accountant/tax advisers...) - propose savings Support team recruitment support, organize training, bring team together "]

The Project Manager will take responsibility to manage overall project to ensure smooth installation and commissioning operations as well as provide technical consultation for the products across Asia Pacific, South East Asia, Australia, China, Japan, and Korea. Client DetailsOur client is on of the leading consumer packaging equipment company in the world where the regional headquarter is in Bangkok. The company has its presence across the globe with global headquarter in Europe.DescriptionOrganise installation meetings and site inspections on customer site: Plan dates with customer.Schedule service engineers based on skill set and availability, including rigging teams, provisions of tools. Check local conditions for alignment and fulfilment of requirements to space, access, utilities etc. prior to installations are taking place.Brief installation teams on their assignment. Get weekly site reports and secure debriefing and handover-meetings underway and when completed.Tracking progress of installation, based on daily or weekly reports and follow up with action planning. Managing scheduling changes, coordination of travel schedules, including flights, hotel, visa, pick-up and availability of spare parts and tools.Organizing shipment according to letter of credit terms and conditions.Planning customer training.Follow up on pending items during and after installation. Secure efficient hand-over to after sales when Warranty is ending.Liaise with regional and local sales for direct communication to customers as necessary.Analyze requirements and requests - claim management and quality issues - to support customer and service teams to respond to technical issues before, under and after acceptance.Manage free of charge supplies, coordinate technical problems between technicians, with the manufacturer, handling error messages, part identification and shipment.Budget control responsibility for rigging, commissioning, training, acceptance runs and acceptance.Control of Service engineers report responsibilities, weekly time report, weekly site report, monthly travel expense reports are submitted in due time.ProfileBachelor in Mechanical or Electrical EngineeringFluent command in English, German is preferably7 - 10 years of experience in Project Management (service company is preferably)Willing to travel domestically and internationallyInternational exposure would be advantageExperience in big project would be advantageJob OfferOpportunity to work in regional levelCompetitive package To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Janejira Pannavatkulthon on +66 2012 5036.

job_description: หน้าที่และควมรับผิดชอบควบคุมการตรวจสอบคุณภาพงานก่อสร้าง ระบบ RC และการก่อสร้างแบบ Precast และ Tunnel Formพัฒนาระบบการทำงานของฝ่ายก่อสร้างโครงการให้เป็นไปตามคุณภาพที่กำหนดไว้กำหนดทิศทางมาตรฐานการตรวจสอบคุณภาพให้กับโครงการต่าง ๆ ได้ปฏิบัติตามอย่างเป็นรูปธรรมงานอื่น ๆ ตามที่ได้รับมอบหมายคุณสมบัติ:เพศชาย อายุ 35 - 45 ปีวุฒิปริญญาตรี (วศ.บ) โยธา มีใบประกอบวิชาชีพ (ก.ว.)มีประสบการณ์ควบคุมคุณภาพการสร้างบ้านPrecast -Tunnel form3 ปีขึ้นไปต้องมีประสบการณ์ควบคุมงานก่อสร้างบ้านแนวราบสามารถทำงานภายใต้สภาวะแรงกดดันได้ดีสามารถขับขี่รถยนต์ได้ และมีใบอนุญาตขับขี่รถยนต์ส่วนบุคคล จะพิจารณาเป็นพิเศษสวัสดิการ:กองทุนสำรองเลี้ยงชีพประกันสุขภาพประกันสังคมสวัสดิการกู้ซื้อบ้านส่วนลดสำหรับพนักงานในการซื้อบ้านของโครงการมีโบนัสประจำปีผู้สมัครที่มีความสนใจกรุณาส่งประวัติการทำงาน พร้อมรูปถ่ายมาที่ฝ่ายทรัพยากรมนุษย์ สำนักงานใหญ่ บริษัท ลลิล พร็อพเพอร์ตี้ จำกัด (มหาชน)222/2 ถ.ศรีนครินทร์ แขวงหัวหมาก เขตบางกะปิ กรุงเทพฯ 10240โทร. 02-732-1041-5 ต่อ 207, 217 ,081-8709111Fax 02-732-3814

As a result of expanding both within Thailand and globally, this world's leading FMCG manufacturer is recruiting a talented Continuous Improvement Manager (x1 vacancy) to responsible for the development and execution of the MOS (Manufacturing Operating System) within the plant. The MOS is a programme based in TPM combining pragmatically Lean and Six Sigma capabilitiesAbout the Continuous Improvement Manager role:Reporting to Plant Manager (Thai), you will play a vital role to promote and encourage prompt delivery of programme regarding to cost saving, efficiency improvement, accountability and excellence in all programmes within their manufacturer located in Chachoengsao. The salary range is THB 150k to 200k per month with Allowance + Bonus + Provident Fund.Key Responsibilities:Develop Manufacturing Operating System (MOS) implementation plan for the related factory, with clear focus on zero defects, zero losses and total involvement culture. This plan needs to be consistent with company's global standardPuts in place in the plant the standard MOS Pillar structure (TPM Pillar structure), enabler of the MOS Continuous Improvement programmeLocal Fundamentals Pillar leader, including OPS (Daily performance meetings structure), Basic problem-solving tools (Root Cause Analysis, Kaizen, SMED) and 5SCollaborate effectively with the rest of the Management Team of the plant (Plant Manager, Production Manager, Engineering Manager, Quality Manager, Safety Manager, Logistics Manager, Plant Controller, and HR Manager) implementing together the MOS programmeWork closely with other Global Pillar leaders to ensure flawless Manufacturing Operating System development and implementationTo succeed in this role, you must have the ability to lead and unite effectively and possess a keen understanding of continuous improvement within FMCG industry.Key requirements:Bachelor's degree or higher in engineering or other related fields with a minimum of 5 years' experience in FMCG manufacturing environmentProfound knowledge of TPM (mainly) and Lean and Six Sigma methodologies with proven track record of leading successful implementations at plant levelAbility to listen & integrate business needs with detailed technical inputsGood command of Thai and English is a mustWilling to be based in Chachoengsao and travel overseasThis leading FMCG manufacturer needs no introduction and is recognised as the leader in their field of expertise. The culture is demanding but if you are confident and have a can-do attitude the potential rewards are significant and there are great opportunities to progress in this dynamic company.If you are a progressive Continuous Improvement Manager with solid experience in FMCG manufacturing, this is an excellent opportunity to work with an industrial leader that is consistently breaking new ground.Apply now for this exciting opportunity.Robert Walters Recruitment (Thailand) LimitedRecruitment License No.: น. 1188 / 2551

job_title: Head of Project Engineering and Maintenance
job_description: As a result of expanding, this world's leading FMCG manufacturer based in Rayong is recruiting an outstanding Project Engineering and Maintenance Manager (x 1 vacancy) to responsible for all changes and improvements at the plant, related to new products development, production efficiency improvements and capacity increase starting from scope definition till final hand over to production team as well as maintenance management systemAbout the Head of Project Engineering and Maintenance role:Reporting to the Plant Director (Foreigner) and working closely with Regional Director (Foreigner) based in Singapore, you will play a vital role to maintain the understanding and knowledge of company's standards and best practices in project executions as well as plant's technology and maintenance. The salary range for this role is THB 200k - 250k per month with allowance + bonus + provident fund.Key Responsibilities:Ensure coordinated actions across plant functions as well contractors, suppliers and other partnersEnsure timely plant CAPEX/OPEX budget planning for department as well as project-related budgets and control the execution and manage investment portfolio of the factoryEnsure timely and transparent reporting of Capex projects execution according company standards and manage & control KPI related to engineering function/departmentTake a leading role in defining and execution of plant technical development strategy, ways of reconstruction, reasonable level of process automation, environment protection measures, lean production, industrial safety and energy effectiveness of production as a mid-term and long-term strategyHandle preparation and start-up of new production lines and/or products including cross-functional collaboration, problems solving, information exchange. Lead and execute all changes related the product, it's packaging, as well as technological processTo succeed in this role, you must have the ability to lead and unite effectively and possess a keen understanding of project engineering and maintenance management within FMCG industry.Key Requirements:Bachelor's degree or higher in engineering or other related fields with a minimum of five years' experience in FMCG manufacturing environmentKnowledge of main business processes, technology as well as essential stages of manufacturing and packaging of finished productExceptional project management skills with a track record of delivering high quality projects in a manufacturing environmentAbility to listen & integrate business needs with detailed technical inputsGood command of Thai and English is a mustThis leading FMCG manufacturer needs no introduction and is recognised as the leader in their field of expertise. The culture is demanding but if you are confident and have a can-do attitude the potential rewards are significant and there are great opportunities to progress in this dynamic company.If you are a progressive Project Engineering and Maintenance Manager with solid experience in FMCG manufacturing, this is an excellent opportunity to work with an industrial leader that is consistently breaking new ground.Apply today for this exciting opportunity.Robert Walters Recruitment (Thailand) LimitedRecruitment License No.: น. 1188 / 2551

Coaches team for proper guidance in connection with their functions and responsibilities.Developing the Process parameter and continue improvement for productivities, Safety, food safety, and SustainabilityPerforms other tasks / duties in support of the goals and objective of the business.Follow QFS Procedure and monitoring process to ensure that Product without Quality Food safety IssueFollow Safety Procedure and monitoring process to ensure that machine and equipment without safety IssueFollowing job / task assignment from Engineering ManagerThe PersonMale / Female, age 35 - 48, with a degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering . Master's Degree or overseas education would be a plus 10+yrs experience in leading & managing Utility Maintenance Operation from Consumer / Food / FMCG industries with knowledge of Utility equipment & systems maintenance and related engineering improvement for Waste Water, Boiler, HVAC, Electrical Supply, and all other facilities within manufacturing companiesMust have experience with multi -national manufacturing companiesTeam leadership Good communication skills in EnglishIf you are interested, please apply via Jobs DBArgyll Scott Asia is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

job_description: Main Responsibilities:Responsible for making sure that buildings and environment is in a suitable condition to work.Manage the maintenance of building i.e. security, parking, water pump and air conditioning as needed.Control and manage budget for various facility needs and expenses.Managing and monitoring service provider and outsourcing services to work efficiently.Planning maintenance for all installations as scheduled.Handle certain administrative tasks, such as preparing reports for owner.Respond to emergency situations or other urgent issues involving the facility.Providing solutions for technical issues.Required Qualifications:Male or Female, age between 28-35 years old.Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering Management, Electrical Engineering, Business Management or related.Background in Facility Management or Building Management in Hotel, Condominium or Serviced Apartment will be preferable.Fair in English and Computer literacy.Good in Problem-solving, analytical skills, planning skills, leadership skills and ability to guide and motivate team.Good communication skills both Thai and English.Can work on flexible hour (8:00 - 17:00 or 10:00 - 20:00)6 day-off / monthWorking Location:- Thonglor and EkkamaiTo become a member of our team, please write in with full resume, stating present and expected salaries, and enclosing a recent photograph via"Apply Now" bottom.Euro Creations Co., Ltd.Contact : Human Resources Department1050 Soi Sukhumvit 66/1, Sukhumvit Road, Bangjak,Phrakanong, Bangkok 10260Tel : 02-744-9624-5 Fax : 02-744-9731mb. 0854844943line id: 0854844943careers at eurocreations.co.thWebsite :www.eurocreations.co.th

Work at Amata City Chonburi**JOB SPECIFICATIONS **Excellent communication of EnglishStrong background in Lean Manufacturing, SixSigma & KaizenKnowledge on Statistical Process control, Financial AnalysisExperienced 5 Years in Production, EngineeringJob description and responsibilitiesMAIN RESPONSIBILITIES KPI- Consumables savings actual vs previous yearIn relation with all concerned departments, animate the dashboard of EOLT on consumables and raw materialSynchronize the plan with EOLT managers, Asia Purchasing and Asia Manufacturing ExcellenceEnsure the organization has a robust cost estimating process in place to meet production/project requirements and in line with quality.Support continuous improvement through cost engineering techniques and processes, identifying inefficiencies and cost optimization opportunitiesAnalyze and identify key areas of improvement and apply cost estimation techniques to drive cost reductions and aid operational processes and efficiencyMonitor and review data and information to detect and assess problems and make recommendations to resolve issuesManage the realization of all projects, actions related to Cost ReductionWith the support from Manufacturing Excellence and Asia Purchasing, organize benchmark with others labsSynchronize the new consumables and raw material with New products flow (example: new AR with new consumables…)Other Compliance Comply with laws, regulations and ISO requirements; manage the related audits or participate to them if appropriatedRevising procedures, reports etc. periodically to identify hidden risks or non-conformity issuesCollaborate with corporate counsels and HR departments to monitor enforcement of standards and regulationsPromote the recruitment of disabled peopleEHS Ensure with EHS there is no impact (or it is manageable) on environment of any consumables and raw materialCommit to plant safety policies and proceduresTo maintain and enhance safety consciousness and awareness in the workplace by respecting EHS rules (ISO 9001, ISO 14001, OHSAS 18001)Implement BBS, near miss and waste management programs in your department in line with Corporate requirementsMISSION   Working closely with others departments, To ensure cost estimating processes are in place and to take the coordinating lead.Responsible of cost targeting and bench marking activities to reach the lowest product costSupport implementation of cost reduction opportunities.Please submit an application letter with your CV including full details work experience, present and expect salary with a recent photograph viaAPPLY NOW
